title: Implement malware detection scanner
description: Add malware detection capability using known-malicious package databases. The 'malware' scan_type already exists in the DB schema. Integrate with OpenSSF Malicious Packages repository data and/or Socket.dev threat feed. At minimum: maintain a local index of known-malicious package name+version pairs, check uploaded artifacts against it, and flag matches. Stretch: behavioral analysis of install scripts in npm/PyPI packages for suspicious patterns (network calls, file system access outside package dir, obfuscated code).

title: Add EPSS and KEV enrichment for vulnerability prioritization
description: Enrich vulnerability findings with EPSS (Exploit Prediction Scoring System) scores and CISA KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) catalog data. JFrog research shows only 12% of 'critical' CVEs deserve that rating. EPSS provides probability of exploitation in the next 30 days, KEV flags actively exploited vulnerabilities. Add epss_score (float) and in_kev (boolean) fields to scan_findings. Fetch EPSS data from FIRST.org API and KEV from CISA JSON feed. Use these to improve the security scoring algorithm and help users prioritize what actually matters.

title: Complete license scanner implementation
description: The license_policies table and license scan_type already exist in the DB schema but the scanner logic is not implemented. Build the LicenseScanner that: parses license fields from package manifests (package.json, Cargo.toml, pom.xml, setup.py, gemspec, nuspec), matches against the SPDX license list, evaluates against existing license_policies table (allow/warn/block actions), and produces findings for non-compliant licenses. Also wire up the license compliance check endpoint that already exists in the SBOM handler.

title: Fix .sort() without comparator in monitoring page
description: SonarCloud S2871 (CRITICAL): monitoring/page.tsx:159 calls .sort() without a compare function. Add explicit string comparator: .sort((a, b) => a.localeCompare(b))
close_reason: Fixed in PR#27. 5 bugs fixed in code, 40 false positives/won't-fix dismissed via SonarCloud API.

title: Fix keyboard accessibility on packages page cards
description: SonarCloud S1082: packages/page.tsx:77 and :122 have clickable div cards (grid and list view) missing role=button, tabIndex={0}, and onKeyDown handler. Keyboard-only users cannot navigate to or activate these items.
close_reason: Fixed in PR#27. 5 bugs fixed in code, 40 false positives/won't-fix dismissed via SonarCloud API.

title: Add onKeyDown handler to file-upload component
description: SonarCloud S1082: file-upload.tsx:106 already has role=button and tabIndex={0} when no file is selected, but missing onKeyDown handler. Add onKeyDown={(e) => { if (\!file && (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ')) handleBrowse(); }} to complete keyboard support.
close_reason: Fixed in PR#27. 5 bugs fixed in code, 40 false positives/won't-fix dismissed via SonarCloud API.

title: Dismiss 40 SonarCloud false positives and won't-fix findings
description:
Dismiss 40 SonarCloud findings via API:

FALSE POSITIVES (21):
- 11x S1082: stopPropagation() wrappers in table action cells, not interactive elements
- 2x S8264/S8233: CI workflow-level permissions (used by 4/5 jobs)
- 1x S4662: @custom-variant is valid Tailwind CSS v4 syntax
- 1x S5256: shadcn/ui Table is a composable primitive, headers from consumers
- 2x S5852: Simple regex in E2E tests, no backtracking risk
- 2x S2068 (hotspots): E2E test credentials and demo auto-login

WON'T FIX (19):
- 14x S7637: GitHub Actions SHA pinning on official actions/docker orgs
- 2x S6504: Dockerfile COPY already uses --chown, runs as non-root
- 1x S6470: Recursive COPY in build stage, discarded in final image
- 1x S6471: Dockerfile.dev root user, dev-only
- 1x S4507: NODE_ENV=development in Dockerfile.dev, intentional
- 1x S2245: Math.random() for UI password pre-fill, not crypto
close_reason: Fixed in PR#27. 5 bugs fixed in code, 40 false positives/won't-fix dismissed via SonarCloud API.

title: Add continuous CVE monitoring with background re-scan
description: Currently scanning is point-in-time (on upload or manual trigger). Implement a background job that periodically checks advisory databases (OSV.dev, GitHub Advisory) for newly disclosed CVEs and re-evaluates existing artifacts. When a new CVE affects an artifact, update its scan findings and security score automatically. Should run on a configurable interval (default: every 6 hours). Notify via webhook or audit log when new vulnerabilities are found in existing artifacts.

title: Implement contextual/reachability analysis for CVE findings
description: JFrog Xray's biggest differentiator: analyze whether application code actually calls the vulnerable function, eliminating ~75% of false-positive CVEs. Implement reachability analysis that checks if the vulnerable package is a direct vs transitive dependency, and if possible, whether the vulnerable code path is reachable. Start with simple heuristics (direct dependency = higher risk, transitive = lower risk) and add call-graph analysis for supported languages (Java, JavaScript, Python) over time. Add reachability_status field to scan_findings (reachable/unreachable/unknown).

title: Upgrade @types/node from 20.x to 25.x
description: Dependabot PR #45 bumps @types/node from 20.19.30 to 25.2.3. Major version bump: should align with the Node.js version actually used in the project. If we upgrade Node to 25, this should be done at the same time. Check for any TypeScript compilation errors with the new type definitions. PR: https://github.com/artifact-keeper/artifact-keeper-web/pull/45

title: Upgrade react-resizable-panels from 3.x to 4.x
description: Dependabot PR #43 bumps react-resizable-panels from 3.0.6 to 4.6.4. Major version bump: review changelog for breaking API changes, update any PanelGroup/Panel/PanelResizeHandle usage if APIs changed, test all views that use resizable panels. PR: https://github.com/artifact-keeper/artifact-keeper-web/pull/43

title: Fix keyboard accessibility on search results cards
description: SonarCloud S1082: search/page.tsx:743 has clickable div cards in search results with onClick navigation but no role=button, tabIndex={0}, or onKeyDown handler. Keyboard users cannot interact with search result cards.
close_reason: Fixed in PR#27. 5 bugs fixed in code, 40 false positives/won't-fix dismissed via SonarCloud API.

title: Implement binary-level deep scanning
description: Scan compiled binaries to detect vendored/bundled dependencies that don't appear in lock files or manifests. JFrog Xray's deep recursive scanning catches hidden vulnerabilities invisible to manifest-only analysis. Start with: Go binaries (embedded module info via 'go version -m'), Rust binaries (panic messages contain crate versions), Java fat JARs (nested JARs in BOOT-INF/lib), .NET assemblies (embedded NuGet references). Extract dependency information from binary artifacts and feed into the existing vulnerability scanning pipeline.

title: Add operational risk scoring for dependencies
description: Go beyond vulnerability scanning to assess operational risk of dependencies: end-of-life package detection (using endoflife.date API), maintainer activity scoring (last commit date, number of maintainers, bus factor), dependency freshness (how many versions behind latest), known typosquat detection (Levenshtein distance from popular packages). Surface as a risk score alongside the existing security score. Helps answer 'is this dependency still maintained and safe to use?'

title: Build cross-artifact impact graph for vulnerability blast radius
description: When a new CVE is disclosed, users need to answer 'which of my Docker images contain this vulnerable library?' Build an impact analysis system that traces vulnerabilities across artifact dependency chains. Use SBOM component data to build a reverse dependency index: given a vulnerable package+version, find all artifacts and container images that include it. Expose via API endpoint: GET /security/impact?cve=CVE-2024-XXXX returning affected artifacts, repositories, and images. This is equivalent to JFrog Xray's Component Graph feature.

title: Upgrade Node.js from 22 to 25
description: Dependabot PR #32 bumps the Node.js base image from 22-alpine to 25-alpine. This is a major version bump that requires testing: verify Next.js 15 compatibility with Node 25, check for breaking changes in Node.js APIs used, test build and runtime behavior, update Dockerfile and any CI node version refs. PR: https://github.com/artifact-keeper/artifact-keeper-web/pull/32

title: Implement secret detection scanner
description: Add a new scanner implementation that detects exposed secrets (API keys, tokens, passwords, private keys) in artifacts. Integrate trufflehog or gitleaks as the scanning engine. The scanner should implement the existing Scanner trait in scanner_service.rs, register as scan_type 'secret', and persist findings as RawFinding entries. Target formats: archives, container images, and source packages. JFrog found 25,000+ exposed secrets in public registries, this is table-stakes for enterprise security.

title: Add IaC misconfiguration scanning
description: Scan Infrastructure-as-Code artifacts for security misconfigurations. Extend the existing quality_check_service framework to cover: Dockerfiles (running as root, using latest tag, exposing unnecessary ports), Helm charts (security context, resource limits, network policies), Terraform files (overly permissive IAM, public S3 buckets, missing encryption). Can integrate with tools like Checkov, tfsec, or hadolint. The existing Helm lint checker provides the pattern to follow.

title: Review React and @types/react version bump
description: Dependabot PR #44 bumps react and @types/react. Needs review to determine scope: check if this is a minor or major bump, verify compatibility with Next.js 15 and all React dependencies, test for any rendering or hydration changes. PR: https://github.com/artifact-keeper/artifact-keeper-web/pull/44
